snippet: The state’s seniors did better on reading and math exams, but New Jersey remained flat in those areas, according to results from the National Assessment of Educational Progress.
abstract: Results of National Assessment of Educational Progress exams show that high school seniors in Connecticut performed better on math and reading tests, but New Jersey and most of nation remained flat in both areas; New York was not one of 13 states that volunteered to report results for test, which was given to 92,000 of nation's estimated 3.2 million seniors between January and March 2013.
lead_paragraph: The state’s seniors did better on reading and math exams, but New Jersey remained flat in those areas, according to results from the National Assessment of Educational Progress.

headline.main: Connecticut Students Show Gains in National Tests
headline.print_headline: Connecticut 12th Graders Post Gains on U.S. Tests, Outperforming Most States
